00020 
00021 // Specification for the base class of each DataspaceUnit
00022 // A DataspaceUnit converts from a specific unit to a neutral unit
00023 // and is used by a DataspaceLib to do a conversion
00024 class DataspaceUnit{
00025         public:
00026                 t_symbol *name;                         
00027 
00029                 DataspaceUnit(char *cName);
00030                 
00032                 virtual ~DataspaceUnit();
00033                 
00036                 virtual void convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output) = 0;
00037 
00040                 virtual void convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms) = 0;
00041 };
00042 
00043 
00044 
00045 // Specification of our base class
00046 class DataspaceLib{
00047         private:
00048                 DataspaceUnit   *inUnit;
00049                 DataspaceUnit   *outUnit;
00050                 t_hashtab               *unitHash;
00051 
00052         protected:
00053                 void registerUnit(void *unit, t_symbol *unitName);
00054                 
00055         public:
00056                 t_symbol                *neutralUnit;
00057                 t_symbol                *name;
00058 
00059                 DataspaceLib(char *cName, char *cNativeUnit);           
00060                 virtual ~DataspaceLib();                                                        
00061                 
00062 /*              JamomaError convert(long                inputNumArgs, 
00063                                                         t_atom          *inputAtoms, 
00064                                                         t_symbol        *inputDataspace, 
00065                                                         long            *outputNumArgs, 
00066                                                         t_atom          **outputAtoms, 
00067                                                         t_symbol        *outputDataspace, 
00068                                                         );
00069 */
00070 
00071                 // EXTREMELY IMPORTANT: We are expecting that **output atoms has its memory passed in already - we are not allocating it
00072                 // due to performance considerations
00073                 JamomaError convert(long                inputNumArgs,
00074                                                         t_atom          *inputAtoms,
00075                                                         long            *outputNumArgs,
00076                                                         t_atom          **outputAtoms
00077                                                         );
00078                 // could also create a class that wraps a unit with it's dataspace information and args and whateverelse
00079                 // and then have an alternative (overridden) version of the convert method
00080                 
00081                 JamomaError setInputUnit(t_symbol *inUnitName);
00082                 JamomaError setOutputUnit(t_symbol *outUnitName);
00083                 
00084                 void getAvailableUnits(long *numUnits, t_symbol ***unitNames);
00085 };
